  14. (**************************************************************************)

  16. (** Arrays of weak pointers and hash sets of weak pointers. *)


  19. (** {1 Low-level functions} *)

  21. ‌type !'a t
  22. (** The type of arrays of weak pointers (weak arrays).  A weak
  23.    pointer is a value that the garbage collector may erase whenever
  24.    the value is not used any more (through normal pointers) by the
  25.    program.  Note that finalisation functions are run before the
  26.    weak pointers are erased, because the finalisation functions
  27.    can make values alive again (before 4.03 the finalisation
  28.    functions were run after).

  30.    A weak pointer is said to be full if it points to a value,
  31.    empty if the value was erased by the GC.

  33.    Notes:
  34.    - Integers are not allocated and cannot be stored in weak arrays.
  35.    - Weak arrays cannot be marshaled using {!Stdlib.output_value}
  36.      nor the functions of the {!Marshal} module.
  37. *)


  40. ‌val create : int -> 'a t
  41. (** [Weak.create n] returns a new weak array of length [n].
  42.    All the pointers are initially empty.
  43.    @raise Invalid_argument
  44.    if [n] is not comprised between zero and
  45.    {!Obj.Ephemeron.max_ephe_length} (limits included).*)

  47. ‌val length : 'a t -> int
  48. (** [Weak.length ar] returns the length (number of elements) of
  49.    [ar].*)

  51. ‌val set : 'a t -> int -> 'a option -> unit
  52. (** [Weak.set ar n (Some el)] sets the [n]th cell of [ar] to be a
  53.    (full) pointer to [el]; [Weak.set ar n None] sets the [n]th
  54.    cell of [ar] to empty.
  55.    @raise Invalid_argument if [n] is not in the range
  56.    0 to {!Weak.length}[ ar - 1].*)

  58. ‌val get : 'a t -> int -> 'a option
  59. (** [Weak.get ar n] returns None if the [n]th cell of [ar] is
  60.    empty, [Some x] (where [x] is the value) if it is full.
  61.    @raise Invalid_argument if [n] is not in the range
  62.    0 to {!Weak.length}[ ar - 1].*)

  64. ‌val get_copy : 'a t -> int -> 'a option
  65. (** [Weak.get_copy ar n] returns None if the [n]th cell of [ar] is
  66.    empty, [Some x] (where [x] is a (shallow) copy of the value) if
  67.    it is full.
  68.    In addition to pitfalls with mutable values, the interesting
  69.    difference with [get] is that [get_copy] does not prevent
  70.    the incremental GC from erasing the value in its current cycle
  71.    ([get] may delay the erasure to the next GC cycle).
  72.    @raise Invalid_argument if [n] is not in the range
  73.    0 to {!Weak.length}[ ar - 1].

  75.    If the element is a custom block it is not copied.

  77. *)


  80. ‌val check : 'a t -> int -> bool
  81. (** [Weak.check ar n] returns [true] if the [n]th cell of [ar] is
  82.    full, [false] if it is empty.  Note that even if [Weak.check ar n]
  83.    returns [true], a subsequent {!Weak.get}[ ar n] can return [None].
  84.    @raise Invalid_argument if [n] is not in the range
  85.    0 to {!Weak.length}[ ar - 1].*)

  87. ‌val fill : 'a t -> int -> int -> 'a option -> unit
  88. (** [Weak.fill ar ofs len el] sets to [el] all pointers of [ar] from
  89.    [ofs] to [ofs + len - 1].
  90.    @raise Invalid_argument
  91.    if [ofs] and [len] do not designate a valid subarray of [ar].*)

  93. ‌val blit : 'a t -> int -> 'a t -> int -> int -> unit
  94. (** [Weak.blit ar1 off1 ar2 off2 len] copies [len] weak pointers
  95.    from [ar1] (starting at [off1]) to [ar2] (starting at [off2]).
  96.    It works correctly even if [ar1] and [ar2] are the same.
  97.    @raise Invalid_argument if [off1] and [len] do
  98.    not designate a valid subarray of [ar1], or if [off2] and [len]
  99.    do not designate a valid subarray of [ar2].*)


  102. (** {1 Weak hash sets} *)

  104. (** A weak hash set is a hashed set of values.  Each value may
  105.     magically disappear from the set when it is not used by the
  106.     rest of the program any more.  This is normally used to share
  107.     data structures without inducing memory leaks.
  108.     Weak hash sets are defined on values from a {!Hashtbl.HashedType}
  109.     module; the [equal] relation and [hash] function are taken from that
  110.     module.  We will say that [v] is an instance of [x] if [equal x v]
  111.     is [true].

  113.     The [equal] relation must be able to work on a shallow copy of
  114.     the values and give the same result as with the values themselves.
  115.     *)

  117. (** {b Unsynchronized accesses}

  119.     Unsynchronized accesses to weak hash sets are a programming error.
  120.     Unsynchronized accesses to a weak hash set may lead to an invalid weak hash
  121.     set state. Thus, concurrent accesses to weak hash sets must be synchronized
  122.     (for instance with a {!Mutex.t}).
  123. *)

  125. module type S = sig
  126. ‌  type data
  127.   (** The type of the elements stored in the table. *)

  129. ‌  type t
  130.     (** The type of tables that contain elements of type [data].
  131.         Note that weak hash sets cannot be marshaled using
  132.         {!Stdlib.output_value} or the functions of the {!Marshal}
  133.         module. *)

  135. ‌  val create : int -> t
  136.     (** [create n] creates a new empty weak hash set, of initial
  137.         size [n].  The table will grow as needed. *)

  139. ‌  val clear : t -> unit
  140.   (** Remove all elements from the table. *)

  142. ‌  val merge : t -> data -> data
  143.     (** [merge t x] returns an instance of [x] found in [t] if any,
  144.         or else adds [x] to [t] and return [x]. *)

  146. ‌  val add : t -> data -> unit
  147.     (** [add t x] adds [x] to [t].  If there is already an instance
  148.         of [x] in [t], it is unspecified which one will be
  149.         returned by subsequent calls to [find] and [merge]. *)

  151. ‌  val remove : t -> data -> unit
  152.     (** [remove t x] removes from [t] one instance of [x].  Does
  153.         nothing if there is no instance of [x] in [t]. *)

  155. ‌  val find : t -> data -> data
  156.     (** [find t x] returns an instance of [x] found in [t].
  157.         @raise Not_found if there is no such element. *)

  159. ‌  val find_opt: t -> data -> data option
  160.     (** [find_opt t x] returns an instance of [x] found in [t]
  161.         or [None] if there is no such element.
  162.         @since 4.05
  163.     *)

  165. ‌  val find_all : t -> data -> data list
  166.     (** [find_all t x] returns a list of all the instances of [x]
  167.         found in [t]. *)

  169. ‌  val mem : t -> data -> bool
  170.     (** [mem t x] returns [true] if there is at least one instance
  171.         of [x] in [t], false otherwise. *)

  173. ‌  val iter : (data -> unit) -> t -> unit
  174.     (** [iter f t] calls [f] on each element of [t], in some unspecified
  175.         order.  It is not specified what happens if [f] tries to change
  176.         [t] itself. *)

  178. ‌  val fold : (data -> 'acc -> 'acc) -> t -> 'acc -> 'acc
  179.     (** [fold f t init] computes [(f d1 (... (f dN init)))] where
  180.         [d1 ... dN] are the elements of [t] in some unspecified order.
  181.         It is not specified what happens if [f] tries to change [t]
  182.         itself. *)

  184. ‌  val count : t -> int
  185.     (** Count the number of elements in the table.  [count t] gives the
  186.         same result as [fold (fun _ n -> n+1) t 0] but does not delay the
  187.         deallocation of the dead elements. *)

  189. ‌  val stats : t -> int * int * int * int * int * int
  190.     (** Return statistics on the table.  The numbers are, in order:
  191.         table length, number of entries, sum of bucket lengths,
  192.         smallest bucket length, median bucket length, biggest bucket length. *)
  193. end
  194. (** The output signature of the functor {!Weak.Make}. *)

  196. module Make (H : Hashtbl.HashedType) : S with type data = H.t
  197. (** Functor building an implementation of the weak hash set structure.
  198.     [H.equal] can't be the physical equality, since only shallow
  199.     copies of the elements in the set are given to it.
  200. *)
